humanum_full_description_en:
One is like the shape of a burnt earthenware, the original meaning is a utensil made with earth; the other is the shape of like scales, the original meaning is a roof tile. "Shu Wen": "Earthware, the general name of burnt. Pictogram. All tiles belong to the tile." Duan Yucai's note: "Any earthenware that has not been burnt is called bad (blank), and burned is called it. watt."

The characters on bamboo slips and silk use "earthware" meaning, such as "Sleeping Tiger Di Qin Bamboo Slips. Eighteen Kinds of Laws of the Qin Dynasty 148: "Chengdan pounded and destroyed pottery, iron, and wood"; another example is "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips." The 71 back of the Japanese Book of A Type: "Zang (hidden) in the pottery is idle, and when it is closed, it opens the West." Tang poetry also uses this meaning, such as Han Yu's "Yuanhe Shengde Poem": "The emperor is diligent and thrifty, washes the terracotta tiles, denounces Send out the glitz, good for this Á∫ªÁ∫ª."

Ancient books, bamboo slips and silk texts and Tang poetry also use the meaning of "roofing tiles", such as "Zhuangzi¬∑Dasheng": "Though you have a heart, do not complain about floating tiles." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. "Closed Diagnosis Ceremony" 9: "In Yuer Nei, each has households, the interiors are all tiled, big wooden furniture, and ten woods." Du Fu, "The Song of the King of Yue": "The tall buildings rise from the northwest of the isolated city, and the green tiles and Zhuszhao the city." .

The meaning of "tile" can be derived from the meaning of shield ridge (back arched like a covered tile) and tile shape. In the Song and Yuan dynasties, there was also a place for amusement and trade in the city called "Washi" (Washe), which means "tiles join when they come, and disintegrate when they go," (Wu Zimu's "Menglianglu").
407 Characters
humanum_short_description_en: One is the shape of a fired earthenware vessel, the original meaning is a vessel made with soil; the other is the shape of an image like scales, the original meaning is a roof tile.

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªw«éÔºΩ
["Guangyun" five widows cut, go on horse, doubt. ]
(1) The general term for ancient pottery.
(2) A spindle made from ancient clay.
(3) Another name for "earth" in the ancient eight sounds.
(4) Building materials for roofing. It is usually fired with clay, but it is also made of other materials.
(5) Refers to the arched part in the middle of the object.
(6) A place for business travel and amusement in Songyuan City.
(7) The number of hexagrams or hexagrams considered taboo by ancient Shushu scholars.
(8) Abbreviation for the power unit of electricity, watt. Detailed "Watt".
